short_summary: Manual for Flood Frequency Analysis (FFA) for Engineers in Canada
description: Create a reference manual for engineers in Canada that outlines flood frequency analysis methods, their application, limitations, and input variables data to help prepare for future floods.
full_summary:
**Flood Frequency Analysis (FFA) Manual for Hydrotechnical Practitioners in Canada**

**Solicitation Number:** 5000075974

The Department of Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) invites proposals to develop a Flood Frequency Analysis (FFA) Manual for hydrotechnical practitioners in Canada. The manual will provide guidance on flood frequency analysis methods, their application, and tools to complete the analysis.

**Background:**

The Flood Hazard Identification and Mapping Program (FHIMP) is an initiative of the Government of Canada to help Canadians better plan and prepare for future floods. ECCC provides guidance and best practices for hydrology, hydraulics, climate change impacts, and uncertainty.

**Objective:**

The objective of this contract is to create a reference manual for hydrotechnical practitioners in Canada to assist with preparing for future floods. The manual will describe various flood frequency analysis methods, including their application, strengths, and weaknesses. Each method will include a worked example, computer code, and software options available to carry out the FFA.

**Evaluation and Selection Methodology:**

The evaluation and selection methodology will focus on the highest rated proposal within the stipulated maximum budget.

**Contract Period:**

The contract is anticipated to be for a period of approximately six (6) months, with the possibility of an additional six (6) months.

**Security Requirements:**

There are no security requirements associated with this solicitation.

**Socio-Economic Benefits:**

ECCC encourages bids from businesses owned or led by Canadians from under-represented groups, such as women, LGBTQ2+ persons, persons with disabilities, and persons from visible minorities.

**Contact Information:**

For additional information, interested suppliers must contact Maureen Mateush, Contracting Officer, at (431) 813-6439 or [maureen.mateush@ec.gc.ca](mailto:maureen.mateush@ec.gc.ca).

Note: The manual will be a guide for hydrotechnical practitioners to assist them in completing a flood frequency analysis. It will provide information on various methods, their application, and tools available to complete the analysis. The contract is for a period of approximately six (6) months with an option of an additional six (6) months. There are no security requirements associated with this solicitation. ECCC encourages bids from businesses owned or led by Canadians from under-represented groups. The contractor must provide a reference manual detailing the various flood frequency analysis methods, their application,
